page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: FARMING There are many farms in the area which have mainly mixed farming in some form.We visited Mr.Williams of Netherton Farm. He owns 540 acres.This year his main crop is Barley but he also has grass and potatoes for silage and grazing.He has over 200 bullocks for beef and over 1100 pigs for bacon and saugage.Mr.Roylance's Mickledale Farm also has Barley as his main crop and like Mr Williams he grows potatoes and grass for silage and grazing.He grows Rape as well.Rape looks like cabbage but has bright yellow flowers.It is used as a drought feed in summer.He has 55 milking cows,23 heifers,25 calves and 20 hens.He has 12 cats for catching mice.
